title: No signal when enter right to loading screen
body: So after i patched up my league client with the released 7.1 i decided to play a ranked game , all good waited the 27 seconds to all players to get onto the loading screen , league logo on desktop , screen goes black as usual and it has to show the loading borders of every player right ? well gues what , no signal on the screen monitor out of range , i couldn't do anything just to restart my computer , i entered again i got 5 bans with 20 minutes for leavebuster , decided to see if the issue perssist's ,  i made a custom game just added 1 bot and start the game , league logo as you know , and boom no signal again , had to restart the computer again , please if someone has issued this problem help me out!{{item:3070}}

replies.body:
I looked into this further and it seems this is part of a known issue with Patch 7.1 that causes this *no signal* or *out of range* issue for some players when entering a match. You can bypass it by hitting **CTRL** + **ENTER** when you see the black screen in place of the loading screen, which will toggle you out of *Full Screen* mode and switch you over to *Windowed* or *Borderless*. If this workaround didn't work for you, try our other workaround listed in [**this post**](http://boards.euw.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/help-support-en/VJeqP4UK-fullscreen-issueout-of-range-issue).

We're looking into the issue to find a solution as soon as possible, but I'm unable to provide an ETA on the permanent fix at the moment. If you have any other questions, let me know.

It sounds like there's something up with your display driver or video card, since you're losing display entirely. I'd strongly recommend going through the steps in our [**FPS Guide**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752684-Low-Frame-Rate-FPS-Troubleshooting), as it goes over basic steps like updating your driver and checking for power setting issues. These steps are necessary for determining exactly what's causing these frustrating things to happen.

If you still experience issues after taking those steps, please let me know.

I have a Dell Gaming S2716DG 27.0" Screen LED-Lit Monitor with G-SYNC, GeForce Windforce GTX 980 TI, and an Avocent KVM switch to switch between my work laptop and gaming rig.

Was able to play last night - logged in this morning to play a game before work, patched, and during game load (after champ select), screen flickers off and on for about 1 minute and then goes blank starting sleep mode.

Appears to be a sync issue similar to selecting a resolution higher than your screen is capable of displaying. Tried disabling GSYNC to troubleshoot in game, apologized to the people I was playing with and told them my screen isn't stabilizing. I can't adjust options in game, thought I'd try and change display settings and see if that would fix the issue. My guess is that you've enabled some low level hardware controls in the game, and you're bypassing the settings that are controlled in GeForce Experience settings - which can be useful to handle clients that have settings that degrade performance and are unaware of proper setting controls, but you've totally locked me out and possibly others with similar configurations.

Edit: Just to add, I normally play at 2560x1440.
